review_title: The cons outweigh the pros of working for this organisation (at least in India)
pros:
- Flexibility with schedule
- Good work-life balance
cons:
- The incompetent people at the top in the Indian wing will bring down the entire organisation soon enough - no passion, no motivation, no compassion, all in all very poor leadership 
- Pay and benefits really low (given that NGO standards are already low)
- Not much room to grow upwards in career, which can get pretty frustrating

review_title: Good if you're looking for experience
pros:
*Lots of work experience to be gained if you work for them
*One of the more dedicated NGOs in the field (at least they were a few years ago)
cons:
*No work-life balance
*Overworked employees
*Zero employee safety
*Very low and exploitative salary and benefits package
